logging

class Level

Object
  |
  +--logging.Level

class Level
extends Object

The Level class defines a set of standard logging levels that can be used to control logging output. The logging Level objects are ordered and are specified by ordered integers. Enabling logging at a given level also enables logging at all higher levels. Clients should normally use the predefined Level constants such as Level.SEVERE.


Author:
Ralf Siegel

Field Summary

public static
ALL: Level
ALL indicates that all messages should be logged

public static
CONFIG: Level
FINEST indicates a highly detailed tracing message.

public static
FINE: Level
FINER indicates a fairly detailed tracing message.

public static
FINER: Level
FINE is a message level providing tracing information.

public static
FINEST: Level
CONFIG is a message level for static configuration messages.

public static
INFO: Level
INFO is a message level for informational messages.

public static
OFF: Level
OFF is a special level that can be used to turn off logging.

public static
SEVERE: Level
SEVERE is a message level indicating a serious failure.

public static
WARNING: Level
WARNING is a message level indicating a potential problem.
